name: Shiv Tandav Stotram
title: Shiv Tandav Stotram - Ravana's Creation
description: A powerful stotram composed by Ravana, the demon king of Lanka, describing Lord Shiva's cosmic dance (Tandava). This hymn beautifully captures the divine power and beauty of Lord Shiva's dance of creation and destruction.
significance: Invokes Lord Shiva's divine power, brings spiritual strength, and helps overcome ego and obstacles.

seo.description: Complete Shiv Tandav Stotram with lyrics, meaning, and benefits. Learn the proper way to recite this powerful Shiva stotram.

sections.title: Shiv Tandav Stotram
sections.content: The Shiv Tandav Stotram is a magnificent hymn that describes Lord Shiva's cosmic dance, composed by none other than Ravana, the greatest devotee of Shiva despite being a demon king.

sections.title: Historical Significance
sections.content: This stotram was composed by Ravana after he pleased Lord Shiva with his intense devotion. It is considered one of the most powerful Shiva stotrams, showcasing the depth of Ravana's devotion despite his demonic nature.

sections.title: Complete Stotram Lyrics
sections.content: The powerful verses describing Shiva's Tandava dance.

subsections.title: Opening Verses
subsections.english:
With his neck consecrated by the flow of water that flows from his hair,
And on his neck a snake, which is hung like a garland,

And the Damaru drum that emits the sound Damad Damad Damad,
I worship that Shiva, who wears matted hair, who wears matted hair.
subsections.meaning: These verses describe Shiva's magnificent appearance with matted hair, snake garland, and the sound of his Damaru drum.

subsections.title: Cosmic Dance Description
subsections.english:
Fierce, fierce, fierce, fierce, fierce, fierce, fierce,
Fierce, fierce, fierce, fierce, fierce, fierce, fierce,

With his neck consecrated by the flow of water that flows from his hair,
And on his neck a snake, which is hung like a garland
subsections.meaning: The repetition emphasizes the fierce nature of Shiva's Tandava dance.

sections.title: Benefits of Reciting Shiv Tandav Stotram
sections.content: The spiritual and practical benefits of regular recitation.

subsections.title: Spiritual Benefits
subsections.content: Removes ego, provides spiritual strength, helps overcome obstacles, and brings divine blessings.

subsections.title: Material Benefits
subsections.content: Increases confidence, provides courage, helps overcome fears, and brings success in endeavors.

sections.title: How to Recite
sections.content: Proper method and guidelines for reciting Shiv Tandav Stotram.

subsections.title: Best Time
subsections.content: Early morning after bath, especially on Mondays and during Mahashivratri.

subsections.title: Procedure
subsections.content: Sit facing north, light a diya, offer bilva leaves and water, then recite with devotion and understanding of the cosmic dance.
